descriptionFull:
Description:



The City of Alvin (the “City” or “City of Alvin”) is seeking proposals from qualified professional planning firms to provide professional consulting services to update the City’s Comprehensive Plan. The selected firm will build upon and coordinate with other recent and concurrent planning efforts and studies. The city’s current comprehensive plan can be found at: https://alvin-tx.gov/DocumentCenter/View/143/2035-Comprehensive-Plan-PDF

The Comprehensive Plan shall include but not be limited to the following planning elements: Future Land Use Map, Housing, Parks, Open Space, Transportation, Sustainability, Impacts of Current and Future Growth, and Historic Preservation. It should include relevant data, illustrative plans, urban design graphics, a realistic implementation plan, and public participation strategies.

The city envisions a process that will create a Comprehensive Plan that will guide responsible development, identify capital improvement projects, and develop sustainability efforts for the next ten years.  An evaluation and appraisal report will be prepared every five years, which will involve thorough review of the plans goals, objectives, policies, and recommendations, as well as reassessment of the overall community vision.

descriptionFull:
Description:



The City of Alvin is seeking proposals from qualified firms to provide comprehensive landscape planning services for various community projects. The selected firm will collaborate closely with city officials, and stakeholders, to enhance the aesthetic landscaping appeal, environmental sustainability, and usability of public spaces in the City of Alvin.

The scope of services for each project will be determined based on individual project needs. Selection of a firm by the city in response to this Request does not guarantee that professional services will be required. The City maintains sole discretion in assigning projects, if any, to the selected firms. The purpose of this RFQ is to establish a pool of the most qualified firms on an as-needed basis for individual projects.

The scope of services includes but is not limited to: Conducting site assessments and analysis of existing conditions, developing conceptual and detailed landscape designs, providing recommendations for plant selection, hardscape materials, and sustainable landscaping practices, collaborating with other design professionals and city departments as necessary, preparing cost estimates and budgets for proposed designs, presenting designs to city officials, and other stakeholders for feedback, finalizing design plans based on feedback and obtaining necessary approvals, providing construction oversight and project management services as needed, and ensuring compliance with all local, state, and federal regulations.

descriptionFull:
Description:



The project includes expanding the Alvin Wastewater Treatment Plant (WWTP) from 5.0 million gallons per day (MGD) to 7.5 MGD. The expansion includes replacing the existing influent screen and lift station with new coarse screen and lift station and adding a new headworks with fine screens and grit removal. A new train will be added consisting of two aeration basins, two secondary clarifiers, and a chlorine contact basin. The existing chemical building will be replaced with new chemical feed and storage facilities. Solids handling improvements will include adding mechanical thickeners and expanding the dewatering building to add a second belt filter press. The project also includes improvements to the existing facilities including replacing existing electrical gear, pumps, and blowers, and miscellaneous structural and process mechanical improvements. The estimated construction budget is $58.5 million.  See RFP Download provided below.
